content.description: This is a fun problem on some old crumbling granite. It starts sitting with feet on a low rail, a left hand side pull, and a right hand 2 pad crimp. you travel up to a sharp crimp, then traverse left to a sloped pitch. Follow that up and right to the top-out.
content.protection: 1 or 2 crash pads, and spotters. Maybe spotters should have helmets, because there are loose rocks.
content.location:
Head past the boozing boulders, look to your right. 

  You can walk back down off to the left, leaves make it slippery.

content.description: This is the bigget wall here at 14 feet.  It's about 50 feet wide and loaded with climable if slightly decomposed granite.  But, ton of options and traverses will reward a little exploration.  Many problems in the V0 toto V3 range.
